headline: Yancoal wins FIRB approval for Rio Tinto coal deal
text:
Chinese dominated miner Yancoal has won approval from Australia's Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB) to buy Rio Tinto's Hunter Valley coal mine, rail and port assets.

Yancoal said the development was a "critical milestone" in the $US2.45 billion ($3.25 billion) transaction, which was launched in January and will make Yancoal one of Australia's biggest coal exporters.

Yancoal's Hong Kong listed parent Yanzhou had internally dubbed the acquisition "Project Monkey King", partly because the plan was hatched in the chinese year of the monkey.

FIRB said it had no objection so long as existing governance conditions that already apply to Yancoal were maintained.
summary:
Chinese dominated miner Yancoal has won approval from Australia's Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB) to buy Rio Tinto's Hunter Valley coal mine, rail and port assets.
Yancoal said the development was a "critical milestone" in the $US2.45 billion ($3.25 billion) transaction, which was launched in January and will make Yancoal one of Australia's biggest coal exporters.
FIRB said it had no objection so long as existing governance conditions that already apply to Yancoal were maintained.
Yancoal's Hong Kong listed parent Yanzhou had internally dubbed the acquisition "Project Monkey King", partly because the plan was hatched in the chinese year of the monkey.
